meanings.definition: Squeeze or twist (something) forcefully in order to extract liquid.
meanings.sent1: She wrung the wet towel to remove excess water.
meanings.sent2: He always wrung out the sponge after washing dishes.
meanings.sent3: The chef wrung the lemon so hard, the juice squirted into his eye!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt wrung out after the emotional conversation.
meanings.sent5: The old rag was wrung until not a drop of water remained.

meanings.definition: Past tense and past participle of wring.
meanings.sent1: She had wrung the cloth dry before hanging it out to dry.
meanings.sent2: He had wrung his hands in worry before the good news arrived.
meanings.sent3: The detective wrung the truth out of the suspect during interrogation.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day still wrung his heart with sadness.
meanings.sent5: The victory had wrung out every last bit of energy from the team.
